citations.narrative:
The fence of the bison enclosure is in disrepair in numerous locations. The approximately two-acre enclosure is fenced
with a mix of eight-foot metal chain-linked fencing with metal posts and six-foot chain-link fencing with wooden posts.
Many sections of both fencing types have the following areas of disrepair: Metal clips have detached from the posts,
leading to a fence that can sag when pressure is applied. Metal bars on the bottom of the fence have detached or have
bent, leading to areas of the fence that can easily move when pushed on. Loose wires have left sharp points. Both the
main gate and the smaller accessory gait have areas on the bottom of the fence that are loose. Within the enclosure,
there is an incomplete fence line that has sharp points protruding into the enclosure. A wooden fence post is leaning at an
approximately 60-degree angle and pulling the metal fence along with it. Fences in disrepair may lead to animal injury,
animal escapes, and human injury. Fences must be maintained such that at they are structurally sound and in good
repair.
Correct by 8/26/24.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
End of report.
Additional Inspectors:
Mary Ann Archer, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER
Shoshana Tanenbaum, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.125(a) 
   
Facilities, general. 
The fence of the bison enclosure is in disrepair in numerous locations. The approximately two-acre enclosure is fenced 
with a mix of eight-foot metal chain-linked fencing with metal posts and six-foot chain-link fencing with wooden posts. 
Many sections of both fencing types have the following areas of disrepair: Metal clips have detached from the posts, 
leading to a fence that can sag when pressure is applied. Metal bars on the bottom of the fence have detached or have 
bent, leading to areas of the fence that can easily move when pushed on. Loose wires have left sharp points. Both the 
main gate and the smaller accessory gait have areas on the bottom of the fence that are loose. Within the enclosure, 
there is an incomplete fence line that has sharp points protruding into the enclosure. A wooden fence post is leaning at an 
approximately 60-degree angle and pulling the metal fence along with it. Fences in disrepair may lead to animal injury, 
animal escapes, and human injury. Fences must be maintained such that at they are structurally sound and in good

Correct by 8/26/24. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative. 
 
End of report. 
 
Additional Inspectors: 
Mary Ann Archer, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER 
Shoshana Tanenbaum, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
